meanings.definition: A house or building where a religious community of women is based.
meanings.sent1: The motherhouses provided a peaceful sanctuary for the nuns.
meanings.sent2: The motherhouses were beautifully adorned with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The motherhouses were so quiet that even the mice tiptoed around.
meanings.sent4: The motherhouses stood tall like ancient guardians of faith.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the motherhouses felt like stepping into a serene oasis of spirituality.

meanings.definition: The main or central location of an organization or institution.
meanings.sent1: The headquarters of the company were known as the motherhouses.
meanings.sent2: All important decisions were made at the motherhouses of the organization.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, everyone kept getting lost in the maze-like motherhouses.
meanings.sent4: The motherhouses buzzed with activity, like a beehive of productivity.
meanings.sent5: The motherhouses served as the beating heart of the entire institution.
